intro: Senecio seretii, commonly known as the Seretii groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, with a grayish or blue-green hue. Senecio seretii produces small yellow flowers that attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
